content:
Congratulations on a successful strength training session on Sunday! Switching to Mondays can be a great idea, depending on your personal schedule and preferences. Here are some pros and cons to consider:

Pros:

* Starting the week with a strength training session can help set a positive tone for the rest of the week and give you a sense of accomplishment.
* You may find that you have more energy and motivation on Mondays, which can help you power through a tough workout.
* If you have a busy schedule on Sundays, switching to Mondays might give you a more consistent and predictable routine.

Cons:

* If you're used to taking it easy on Mondays, you might find it challenging to switch to a high-intensity workout day.
* You might need to adjust your rest and recovery time, as you'll be doing strength training on a day when you're typically not used to it.
* If you have other activities or commitments on Mondays, you might need to adjust your schedule to accommodate your workout.

Ultimately, the decision to switch to Mondays depends on your individual circumstances and preferences. If you're feeling motivated and think you can make it work, go for it! However, if you're unsure or have concerns, you might want to stick with your current Sunday routine or experiment with a different day that works better for you.

By the way, congratulations on completing three sets on the leg press machine! That's a great achievement, and you should be proud of yourself. Keep pushing yourself and celebrating your progress!
